model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Co-workers B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: I feel really fulfilled as a leader and guide. Helping others gives me a sense of purpose.
Co-workers B: I can see that. You always seem to know just what to do to make people feel better.
Co-workers A: Yeah, I've had a lot of practice over the years. It's just something that comes naturally to me.
Co-workers B: Do you remember that time when you were led to a safe place by the commander? You must have felt pretty grateful for his guidance then.
Co-workers A: Absolutely. It was a really tough time and I was so relieved to have someone show me the way. I try to pay it forward by being that kind of leader for others.

MEMORY:
1. [Co-worker A had a positive experience with a commander who helped them feel safe.] - (React) - [Co-worker A is hesitant to bring up the problem with their supervisor for fear of being seen as a tattletale.]
2. [Co-worker B emphasizes the importance of acknowledging privileges and using them to make the world a better place.] - (Want) - [Co-worker B suggests talking to the supervisor if Mary's behavior affects work.] - (Causes) - [Co-worker A asked Mary about her mean behavior, and Mary mentioned personal issues were the cause.]
